intro: Krugella, commonly known as the "false thistle," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species native to southern Africa, characterized by their spiny leaves and showy yellow or orange composite flowers. The plants typically grow in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with their succulent stems and deep root systems. Krugella species are often found in rocky soils and are sometimes used in traditional medicine. Their ecological role includes providing food for pollinators and serving as a habitat for small organisms.
